skill.name: frontend-design
skill.description: Creates unique, production-grade frontend interfaces with exceptional design quality. Use when user asks to build web components, pages, materials, posters, or applications (e.g., websites, landing pages, dashboards, React components, HTML/CSS layouts, or styling/beautifying any web UI). Generates creative, polished code and UI designs that avoid mediocre AI aesthetics.
skill.summary: Creates unique, production-grade frontend interfaces with exceptional design quality. Use when user ...
skill.author: YYH211

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only design guidelines. No executable code, no network access, no file system operations. Contains only instructional content for creating frontend interfaces.

content.value_statement: Generic AI-generated interfaces often look bland and predictable. This skill provides design principles, typography guidance, color systems, and animation techniques to create distinctive, professional web interfaces that stand out.
actual_capabilities: Creates unique web interfaces with distinctive visual aesthetics
Applies design thinking principles before coding
Implements custom typography, color systems, and animations
Builds responsive layouts using Grid and Flexbox
Develops React components with Framer Motion
limitations: Does not generate backend code or APIs
Does not handle database connections or server logic
Does not implement authentication or user management
Does not create native mobile applications

use_cases.title: Build Landing Pages
use_cases.description: Create high-converting landing pages with unique visual identity and smooth animations.

use_cases.title: Design Dashboard Interfaces
use_cases.description: Build data dashboards with thoughtful layout, typography, and interactive elements.

use_cases.title: Develop React Components
use_cases.description: Create reusable component libraries with consistent styling and polished interactions.

prompt_templates.title: Create Landing Page
prompt_templates.scenario: Build a SaaS product landing page
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a landing page for a SaaS product. Use a modern tech aesthetic with unique typography and smooth scroll-triggered animations.

prompt_templates.title: Design Dashboard
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a dark-themed analytics dashboard. Include data cards, charts, and interactive elements with subtle transitions.

prompt_templates.title: React Button Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a set of React button components with variants, sizes, loading states, and unique hover effects.

prompt_templates.title: Mobile Responsive Layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a responsive multi-section layout that adapts gracefully from mobile to desktop with custom animations.

output_examples.input: Create a landing page for a design agency
output: Hero section with bold typography and staggered fade-in animations
Glassmorphism service cards with hover lift effects
Portfolio grid with asymmetry and hover-reveal details
Contact section with gradient background and smooth form transitions

best_practices: Choose a clear design direction before coding and commit to it fully
Use distinctive typography combinations instead of default system fonts
Add purposeful animations that enhance user experience, not distract from it
anti_patterns: Using default fonts like Inter, Roboto, or Arial across all projects
Applying the same white background with purple gradient to every design
Creating generic centered card layouts without visual distinction

faq.question: Which frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: React, Vue, and native HTML/CSS. Tailwind CSS is supported with custom configuration.

faq.question: What animation libraries can I use?
faq.answer: Framer Motion for React, Anime.js, GreenSock, or plain CSS animations.

faq.question: Does this skill handle responsive design?
faq.answer: Yes, mobile-first responsive design is built into the workflow and requirements.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only generates frontend code. It does not access files, networks, or external systems.

faq.question: Why do my designs look generic?
faq.answer: Avoid common patterns: default fonts, purple gradients, centered card grids. This skill helps break those habits.

faq.question: How is this different from a code formatter?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on visual aesthetics, layout creativity, and design thinking, not just code formatting.
